P[source]

P(*args)

Create a DiscreteKeys instances from a variable number of DiscreteKey pairs.

It is currently very annoying to create a set of discrete keys. This is probably because we don't understand pybind11 fully yet.

Discrete keys are represented as pairs in Python, with the first element the key and the second element the cardinality of the discrete variable. This function accepts a variable number of such pairs and creates a gtsam.DiscreteKeys instance.

Returns: DiscreteKeys: an instance of DiscreteKeys.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

DiscretePrior[source]

DiscretePrior(key:int, pmf:str)

A prior on a discrete variable.

This really just creates a gtsam.DiscreteConditional without parents.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
C = 0, 5  # A key is an identifier and a cardinality
prior = DiscretePrior(C, "25/20/30/20/5")
assert not prior.empty()
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

V[source]

V(values)

Convert a dictionary into a DiscreteValues instance.

Args: values (dict): A map from keys to values.

Returns: gtsam.DiscreteValues: an assignment to discrete variables usable by gtsam.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
prior_probability_for_3 = prior(V({0:3}))
assert prior_probability_for_3 == 0.2
{% endraw %}
